Job__03.1: After this Job opened his mouth, and <u>cursed his day</u>,
Job__03.3: Let the day perish wherein I was born, and the night in which it was said: A man child is conceived.
Job__03.4: Let that day be turned into darkness, let not God regard it from above, and let not the light shine upon it.
Job__03.5: Let darkness, and the shadow of death cover it, let a mist overspread it, and let it be wrapped up in bitterness.
Job__03.6: Let a darksome whirlwind seize upon that night, let it not be counted in the days of the year, nor numbered in the months.
Job__03.7: Let that night be solitary, and not worthy of praise.
Job__03.8: Let them curse it who curse the day. who are ready to raise up a leviathan:
Job__03.9: Let the stars be darkened with the mist thereof: let it expect light and not see it, nor the rising of the dawning of the day:
Job__03.10: Because it shut not up the doors of the womb that bore me, nor took away evils from my eyes.
Job__03.11: Why did I not die in the womb, why did I not perish when I came out of the belly?
Job__03.12: Why received upon the knees? why suckled at the breasts?
Job__03.13: For now I should have been asleep and still, and should have rest in my sleep.
Job__03.14: With kings and consuls of the earth, who build themselves solitudes:
Job__03.15: Or with princes, that possess gold, and All their houses with silver:
Job__03.16: Or as a hidden untimely birth I should not be, or as they that being conceived have not seen the light.
Job__03.17: There the wicked cease from tumult, and there the wearied in strength are at rest.
Job__03.18: And they sometime bound together without disquiet, have not heard the voice of the oppressor.
Job__03.19: The small and great are there, and the servant is free from his master.
Job__03.20: Why is light given to him that is in misery, and life to them that are in bitterness of soul?
Job__03.21: That look for death, and it cometh not, as they that dig for a treasure:
Job__03.22: And they rejoice exceedingly when they have found the grave.
Job__03.23: To a man whose way is hidden, and God hath surrounded him with darkness?
Job__03.24: Before I eat I sigh: and as overflowing waters, so is my roaring:
Job__03.25: For the fear which I feared hath come upon me: and that which I was afraid of, hath befallen me.
Job__03.26: Have I not dissembled? have I not kept silence? have I not been quiet? and indignation is come upon me.
